scope_of_work.notes:

scope_of_work.problem: Following the Ph1/Ph1A chilled water energy saving rebalance system project, Ph1 chiller PD switches require replacement
scope_of_work.scope: Replace Ph1 chiller PD switches and complete rebalance system flows
scope_of_work.justification: Phase 1 Chillers during the rebalance and flow reduction were found to trip the chillers on low flow due to operation range of PD switches thus suitable switches required
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: The rebalance project was not completed for Ph1 due to chiller failure on low flow thus back out was required. The annual saving is £90k and will not be realised until these devices are replaced and the flow reduced

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Flo Hodkiewicz

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem:
Boiler room and valve chamber - 
• Two compressors feeding the precaution system are faulty and 
require replacing. 
• The bell on system 5 doesn’t not work and requires replacing.
• The thread on the tun dish is corroded and split so this will 
require replacing.
scope_of_work.scope:
Two Mechanical engineers to attend site for 2 days and 
One Electrical engineer for one day,  in order to supply and 
install the required materials in order for the above noted works to be 
completed in full.
Engineers will isolate the air line and strip out both faulty compressors and install new. Electrical engineer will disconnect and 
reconnect compressors. Mechanical engineers will then strip out faulty 
bell and replace with new and replace the tun dish.
Upon completion, the engineers will re-instate the system and test to 
ensure that all is working efficiently
scope_of_work.justification:
We recommend these works are undertaken to ensure correct and full operation of the fire protection system – please note works not undertaken classified as urgent or high priority will affect the ability of your system 
to act in anger and as such may affect the validity of any certification/approval of your system and therefore 
associated insurances.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect:
We recommend these works are undertaken to ensure correct and full operation of the fire protection system – please note works not undertaken classified as urgent or high priority will affect the ability of your system 
to act in anger and as such may affect the validity of any certification/approval of your system and therefore 
associated insurances.

Replace ignition electrode

scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Without the replacement PC, critical  batteries can not be monitored throughout site, alarms will not come through to the critical team, leaving the site exposed.

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: On recent plant checks it has been picked up that the 500 ltr tank holding Envirobac Q in the chemical dosing room is leaking in to the bund, this is being monitored daily. The chemical from the bund is being decanted into 25kg drums and will be disposed of via Kyndryl's prefered waste disposer.
scope_of_work.scope: CBRE to decant chemical from redundent stock tank in Ph1a powerhouse contractor to disconnect and move to the plantroom where the existing damaged stock tank is located, decant chemical from damadged tank and bund, contractor to install tank and pumps and fill with new chemical. Test and inspect.
scope_of_work.justification: The only way to stop the chemical leak is by replacing the damadged tank fortunately we have a redundant identical tank from PH1a Powerhouse.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Chemical tank to continue leaking into the bund a continued risk of inhalation, although the leak is being managed by decanting from the bund the leak may get worse and overflow the bund causing chemical spill.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Flo Hodkiewicz

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Our fuel level is low in the bulk storage tanks, due to current maintenance work that has taken place.
scope_of_work.scope: Fuel Tanker to arrive on site, and pump fuel into our Bulk storage tank.
scope_of_work.justification: Due to current maintenance works such as HV and ACB maintenance where we have had to run the generators for a long period of time we now need to top up our fuel in the bulk storage tank. if we have an ongoing issue on site where we need to run on generators we need to have the reassurance that we have a suitable amount of fuel in reserve to fulfil the timescale, as we do not want to run out of fuel and the generators to fail, whilst supporting the site.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Due to current maintenance works such as HV and ACB maintenance where we have had to run the generators for a long period of time we now need to top up our fuel in the bulk storage tank. if we have an ongoing issue on site where we need to run on generators we need to have the reassurance that we have a suitable amount of fuel in reserve to fulfil the timescale, as we do not want to run out of fuel and the generators to fail, whilst supporting the site.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Prof. Miracle Abshire (2):rejected by Prof. Miracle Abshire (3):offer submitted by Prof. Miracle Abshire

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Primary chilled water pump replacement due to not being done during the RER project due to IBM funding and is now coming to the end of its working life
scope_of_work.scope:
Attend CBRE office for induction
Sign relevant paperwork 
Remove the existing Worthington Simpson belt drive pump
Install 1no Grundfos NB end suction pump to be supplied by customer
Remove existing pipework and NRVs, back to the current Isolation Valves
Install all new pipework, bellows, NRVs and gasket, to be supplied by customer
Make all mechanical and electrical connections
Test and commission
Arrange for the lagging to be reinstalled or replaced where necessary
scope_of_work.justification:
To complete upgrade works to chilled water pumps started during RER project and stopped due to IBM funding. 
To maintain N+1 on the primary chilled water system PCW pump 3 is running hot and is at the end of its working life as it was installed in 1989"
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: To maintain N+1 on the primary chilled water system PCW pump 3 is running hot and is at the end of its working life as it was installed in 1989
